TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS:  Fine-loamy over sandy or sandy-skeletal, mixed, superactive, nonacid, isohyperthermic Typic Endoaquepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Serrano sand--naturalized pastureland (Colors are for moist soil unless stated otherwise).
A1--0 to 4 inches; very dark grayish brown (2.5Y 3/2) sand; single grain; loose; nonsticky, nonplastic; many fine roots; few fine faint dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) areas of iron depletions; violently effervescent; very strongly alkaline; clear smooth boundary.
A2--4 to 9 inches; very dark grayish brown (2.5Y 3/2) loamy sand; single grain; loose; nonsticky, nonplastic; common fine roots; about 10 percent, by volume, coarse fragments; common faint dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) areas of iron depletions and many fine distinct black (N 2/) masses of iron-manganese; violently effervescent; very strongly alkaline; clear smooth boundary.  (Combined thickness of the A horizons range from 7 to 12 inches)
Bwg--9 to 14 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) sandy clay loam; weak fine subangular blocky structure; firm; slightly sticky, plastic; about 10 percent, by volume, coarse fragments; many distinct dark greenish gray (5GY 4/1) areas of iron depletions and brown (10YR 4/3) masses of iron accumulation; violently effervescent; very strongly alkaline; clear smooth boundary.  (4 to 8 inches thick)
Cg1--14 to 21 inches; very dark grayish brown (2.5Y 3/2) loamy sand; single grain; loose; nonsticky, nonplastic; about 10 percent, by volume, coarse fragments; many medium distinct brown (10YR 4/3) masses of iron accumulations and many fine distinct very dark gray (5Y 3/1) areas of iron depletions; violently effervescent; very strongly alkaline; clear smooth boundary.
Cg2--21 to 50 inches; very dark gray (5Y 3/1) sand; single grain; loose; nonsticky, nonplastic; about 10 percent, by volume, coarse fragments; violently effervescent; strongly alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Ponce Municipality, Puerto Rico.  Approximately 2.1 miles southeast from the intersection of P.R. Hwy 2 and P.R. Hwy 14, about 0.9 mile southeast of Santa Cruz community, about 1,600 feet southeast from dirt road in a pasture.  USGS Playa de Ponce topographic quadrangle, Puerto Rico (1964).  Lat. 17 degrees 58 minutes 41 seconds N.; long 66 degrees 34 minutes 56 seconds W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Solum thickness ranges from 11 to 20 inches.  Content of volcanic fragments range from 5 to 15 percent, by volume in the A and Bwg horizons, from 10 to 80 percent, by volume in the Cg horizon.  Reaction ranges from moderately alkaline to very strongly alkaline throughout.
The A horizon has hue of 10YR to 5Y, value of 3 to 6, and chroma of 1 to 3.  Redoximorphic features in shades of brown and black range from none to common.  Texture is sand, loamy sand, sandy loam, or their gravelly analogs.
The Bwg horizon has hue of 10YR to 5GY, value of 3 to 6, and chroma of 1 or 2; or there is no dominant color and is multicolored in shades of gray, brown, and yellow.  Redoximorphic features in shades of brown, gray, and yellow range from few to many.  Texture is sandy loam, loam or sandy clay loam.
The upper part of the Cg horizon has hue of 10YR to 5G, value of 3 or 4, and chroma of 1 or 2.  Redoximorphic features in shades of brown, gray, and yellow range from few to many.  Texture is sand, loamy sand or loam.
The lower part of the Cg horizon has hue of 10YR to 5G, value of 3 or 4, and chroma of 1 or 2.  Redoximorphic features in shades of brown, gray, and yellow range from few to many.  Texture is sand or loamy sand.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  There are no known series in the same family.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Serrano soils are on tidal flats in the coastal plain.  Slopes range from 0 to 2 percent.  They formed in regolith that consists of moderately fine material over coarse-textured sediments.  The climate is semiarid tropical.  The average annual precipitation ranges from 14 to 45 inches and the average annual temperature ranges from 75 to 81 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Boqueron, Coloso, Manglillo, and Redhook series.  The very poorly drained Boqueron soils are on similar positions, have more clay in the control section, and do not have Cambic horizons.  The somewhat poorly drained Coloso soils are on adjacent flood plains and have more clay in the control section.  The very poorly drained Manglillo soils are on adjacent lower tidal marshes and are organic.  The excessively drained Redhook soils are on higher adjacent vegetated beaches and have sandy-skeletal control sections.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Poorly drained; rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Most areas of Serrano soils are used for wildlife habitat.  The vegetation consists of mangrove and salt tolerant hydrophytic grasses.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Semiarid coastal plains of Puerto Rico.  The series is of minor extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE:  Raleigh, North Carolina.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon:
Ochric Epipedon - the zone from 0 to 9 inches (A1 and A2 horizons).
Cambic horizon - the zone from 9 to 14 inches (Bg horizon).
The seasonal high water table ranges from 4 to 14 inches below the surface.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
